Decorative bands in the Scrovegni chapel

abstract: For the crucifix of this name by Donatello, see Padua Crucifix (Donatello).The Padua Crucifix (Italian - Crocifisso di Padova) is a c. 1303-1305 tempera on poplar panel painting by Giotto. Originally hanging in the centre of the Scrovegni Chapel above the latticework of the iconostasis, it was probably contemporaneous with his frescoes in the same chapel.\nFirst attributed to Giotto in 1864 by Cavalcaselle, that attribution was initially contested by other art critics such as Rintelen, Weigeit and Brandi due to its poor condition at that time but is now accepted after restoration. It is now in the Musei degli Eremitani.

abstract: The Badia Polyptych (Italian: Polittico di Badia) is a painting by the Italian artist   Giotto, painted around 1300 and housed in the Uffizi Gallery of Florence.

St. Francis of Assisi Receiving the Stigmata
abstract: Saint Francis Receiving the Stigmata is a panel painting in tempera by the Italian artist Giotto, painted around 1295–1300 and now in the Musée du Louvre in Paris. It shows an episode from the life of Saint Francis of Assisi, and is 314 cm high (to the top of the triangule) by 162 cm wide.
The Berlin Crucifixion is a c.1320 tempera and gold on panel painting attributed to Giotto. It is now in the Gemäldegalerie in Berlin.

Strasbourg Crucifixion is a c.1320 tempera and gold on panel painting, attributed to Giotto. It is now in the Musée des Beaux-Arts in Strasbourg. It probably formed a diptych with Madonna Enthroned between the Virtues (Wildenstein Collection, New York), attributed to the Master of the Sails.
